result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeannette Marie Tatum

records.addlTxt:
Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing on 11-3-2022, however, the court will not be is session due to a Judicial Conference.
New date confirmed with both the Defense Counsel and the State via email. 
Plea and Sentencing scheduled November 11, 2022 at 9:30am.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jeannette Marie Tatum in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Court accepts global resolution from defendants pending mideamnor case, 2021CT752. Defense requested an adjournment. Court grants the adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-25-2022

Defendant Jeannette Marie Tatum in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for Alexander James Geocaris for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-05-2022

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Jeannette Marie Tatum in court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated March 11, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Violation Report dated March 4, 2022 - received

Defendant Jeannette Marie Tatum in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM bracelet and portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jeannette Marie Tatum in court with attorney .  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/22 @ 1p
